body_html:
Hi,
I'm writing some code that needs to generate on the order of millions of small SVD decompositions. I believe since I updated to 1.6 tensorflow is now defaulting to CPU to calculate these? I'd love to be able to benchmark or verify, but I'm getting a "no kernel found" error if I try to hard-assign my GPU on the calculation.

It seems most of you are able to switch freely between the two, so I am genuinely perplexed. What complicates matters is I have recently upgraded to Windows 10 and updated my Nvidia drivers, so that might also be the case.

Sorry to bother with what amounts to a tech support question :/

Cheers!

body:
Hi,
I'm writing some code that needs to generate on the order of millions of small SVD decompositions. I believe since I updated to 1.6 tensorflow is now defaulting to CPU to calculate these? I'd love to be able to benchmark or verify, but I'm getting a "no kernel found" error if I try to hard-assign my GPU on the calculation.

It seems most of you are able to switch freely between the two, so I am genuinely perplexed. What complicates matters is I have recently upgraded to Windows 10 and updated my Nvidia drivers, so that might also be the case.

Sorry to bother with what amounts to a tech support question :/

Cheers!
